title.value: Nitric food level and sowing terms influence on sorghum productivity and hybrids green weight under conditions of soddy-podzsolic light loam soils of the northeast of Belarus
Влияние уровня азотного питания и сроков сева на урожайность и качество зеленой массы гибридов сорго зернового в условиях дерново-поздолистых легкосуглинистых почв северо-востока Беларуси

journal.title: Agriculture and Plant Protection : scientific-practical journal

person.name: Blokhina, E.A., Belarus State Academy of Agriculture, Gorki (Belarus)

abstract.value: The task of the research was to study the influence of nitrogen nutrition level on the yield of green mass of sorghum depending on the varietal characteristics at different times of sowing conditions in the north-east of Belarus. The following grain sorghum hybrids were used as the object of the study: Slavianskoe pole, Slavianskoe pole 120, Slavianskoe pole 210, and Slavianskoe pole 112. Sowing was carried out with seeds of F1reproduction, obtained from the Institute of sorghum and soybeans 'Slavianskoe pole', Rostov-on-Don. Research results showed that for the conditions of sod-podzolic light loamy soil moderate cultivation optimum dose of nitrogen for early maturing hybrids of grain sorghum is when sown in early June - N60, in mid-June - N80, in early July - N100. Found that the most high-yielding hybrid is the Slavianskoe pole 102 (828.5 kg/ha).
